text: Javier Astúa Araya (born 6 November 1968) is a retired Costa Rican footballer who played as a forward. ==Club career== Born in Quepos, Astúa played several years for Municipal Puntarenas and played 2 matches for Mexican outfit Morelia in September 1992.Mexican league stats - Mediotiempo He had a frustrating 4-month stint at Chilean side Palestino,Javier Astúa se confiesa - Nación before returning to Costa Rica where he joined Alajuelense. He later played for San Carlos, who released him in November 1995 after an injury-hit spell.Separado Astúa - Nación In March 2006, he was released by Herediano.Sacudida en Herediano - Nación He finished his career at Carmelita before more injury cut short his career. He was twice the Costa Rica Premier Division top goalscorer, in 1992 and 1994.Goleadores de Campeonato Nacional - UNAFUT ==International career== He made his debut for Costa Rica in an April 1992 friendly match against El Salvador and earned a total of 13 caps, scoring 7 goals. He has represented his country in 4 FIFA World Cup qualification matches and played at the 1993 UNCAF Nations Cup.UNCAF Tournament 1993 - RSSSF He played his final international game in January 1994 against Norway. ===International goals=== :Scores and results list Costa Rica's goal tally first. {| class="wikitable" |- ! !!
